title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ecclesiastes chapter 5 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ecclesiastes Chapter 5.

questions.question: What should you be more ready to do when going to the house of God, according to Ecclesiastes 5:1?
options: Hear more than to give the sacrifice of fools
questions.correctAnswer: Hear more than to give the sacrifice of fools
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:1 advises to be more ready to hear than to give the sacrifice of fools because they consider not that they do evil.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 5:2, what should you let your words be before God?
questions.correctAnswer: Few
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:2 states that God is in heaven and man on earth, therefore let your words be few.

questions.question: What is a fool's voice known by, according to Ecclesiastes 5:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Multitude of words
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:3 says a fool's voice is known by multitude of words.

questions.question: What should you do when you vow a vow unto God, as instructed in Ecclesiastes 5:4?
questions.correctAnswer: Pay it without delay
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:4 commands not to defer paying a vow to God because He has no pleasure in fools.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 5:5, what is better than vowing and not paying?
questions.correctAnswer: Not to vow at all
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:5 says it is better not to vow than to vow and not pay.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 5:6 warn against causing with your mouth?
questions.correctAnswer: Sin to your flesh
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:6 warns not to let your mouth cause your flesh to sin.

questions.question: What should you fear, according to Ecclesiastes 5:7?
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:7 instructs to fear God despite the multitude of dreams and many words that contain vanities.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 5:8, who regards the oppression of the poor and perverting of judgment?
options: He that is higher than the highest
questions.correctAnswer: He that is higher than the highest
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:8 says that God, who is higher than the highest, regards the oppression and injustice.

questions.question: What is the profit of the earth for, according to Ecclesiastes 5:9?
questions.correctAnswer: For all
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:9 declares the profit of the earth is for all, including the king who is served by the field.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 5:10 states that he who loves silver will be satisfied with silver.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:10 says he that loves silver shall not be satisfied with silver.

questions.question: What happens when goods increase, according to Ecclesiastes 5:11?
options: They are increased that eat them
questions.correctAnswer: They are increased that eat them
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:11 says when goods increase, those who consume them increase as well.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ecclesiastes 5:12, the abundance of the rich causes them to sleep well.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:12 states the abundance of the rich will not suffer him to sleep.

questions.question: What is described as a sore evil under the sun in Ecclesiastes 5:13?
options: Riches kept for their owners to their hurt
questions.correctAnswer: Riches kept for their owners to their hurt
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:13 identifies riches kept for their owners to their hurt as a sore evil.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Ecclesiastes 5:15: 'As he came forth of his mother's womb, naked shall he return to go as he came, and shall take nothing of his ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: labour
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:15 states he shall take nothing of his labour which he may carry away in his hand.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 5:20 says that a man remembers his days of life because God answers him in the joy of his heart.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:20 says he shall not much remember the days of his life because God answers him in the joy of his heart.

medium.title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is about to speak in a church meeting but feels nervous. Based on Ecclesiastes 5, what advice would you give about speaking before God?
options: Be quick to speak and express all your thoughts
Be slow to speak and let your words be few
Speak loudly to be heard clearly
questions.correctAnswer: Be slow to speak and let your words be few
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:1-2 teaches us to be ready to hear rather than to speak rashly before God, letting our words be few because God is in heaven and we are on earth. This encourages humility and reverence in speech.

questions.question: How does Ecclesiastes 5 instruct us about making vows to God?
options: Make many vows and delay fulfilling them
Avoid making any vows at all
Make vows carefully and pay them without delay
Make vows but only fulfill them if convenient
questions.correctAnswer: Make vows carefully and pay them without delay
questions.explanation: Verses 4 and 5 stress the importance of paying what one has vowed promptly, warning that God has no pleasure in fools who vow but do not fulfill. This teaches integrity and faithfulness in commitment.

questions.question: What caution does Ecclesiastes 5 give about the use of many words, especially in dreams or business?
options: A multitude of words often lead to vanity and folly
Speaking more helps you be understood
questions.correctAnswer: A multitude of words often lead to vanity and folly
questions.explanation: Verses 3 and 7 indicate that many words and dreams can bring vanities, and a fool's voice is known by many words. The passage teaches discretion and the danger of empty talk.

questions.question: If a believer sees injustice and oppression, what does Ecclesiastes 5 teach about God's awareness?
options: God is higher than rulers and watches over all
Only human judges can stop injustice
questions.correctAnswer: God is higher than rulers and watches over all
questions.explanation: Verse 8 teaches that though injustice happens, God who is higher than the highest rulers regards all things, assuring believers that God is aware and sovereign over justice.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 5 say about loving silver (wealth) and abundance?
options: Loving silver and abundance is vanity and never satisfied
Wealth is the ultimate goal of life
questions.correctAnswer: Loving silver and abundance is vanity and never satisfied
questions.explanation: Verse 10 explains that those who love silver or abundance will never be satisfied, highlighting the vanity of material greed and the emptiness it brings.

questions.question: How should a believer view the increase of possessions according to Ecclesiastes 5?
options: Possessions increase but so do those who consume them, limiting their benefit
questions.correctAnswer: Possessions increase but so do those who consume them, limiting their benefit
questions.explanation: Verse 11 teaches that as goods increase, those who consume them also increase, so the owner gains little beyond seeing them, reminding us to avoid placing trust in material wealth.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 5 say about the sleep of a laboring person compared to the rich?
options: The rich sleep better than laborers
Laborers sleep sweetly regardless of food, but the rich cannot sleep due to abundance
Both laborers and rich have troubled sleep
Sleep quality is unrelated to wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Laborers sleep sweetly regardless of food, but the rich cannot sleep due to abundance
questions.explanation: Verse 12 contrasts the peaceful sleep of the laborer with the restless sleep of the rich, teaching contentment and warning about the cares wealth can bring.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 5, what is a sorrowful consequence related to riches kept by their owners?
options: Riches kept can cause hurt and vanish through evil toil
questions.correctAnswer: Riches kept can cause hurt and vanish through evil toil
questions.explanation: Verses 13-14 describe riches kept to the owner's hurt and perishing through evil toil, warning against hoarding wealth selfishly and trusting in earthly gain.

questions.question: What reminder does Ecclesiastes 5 give about what a person takes from life when they die?
options: They take all their wealth with them
They take nothing from their labor when they die
questions.correctAnswer: They take nothing from their labor when they die
questions.explanation: Verse 15 teaches that a person comes naked into the world and leaves the same way, carrying nothing from their labor, emphasizing the temporary nature of earthly possessions.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 5 say about the profit of labor that is like 'labouring for the wind'?
options: It is a sore evil and without profit
questions.correctAnswer: It is a sore evil and without profit
questions.explanation: Verse 16 highlights the futility of laboring for wind, meaning working without lasting gain, teaching the need for purposeful, God-centered work.

questions.question: A believer is weary from constant labor and suffering. Based on Ecclesiastes 5, what encouragement can you offer about enjoying the fruits of one’s labor?
options: It is wrong to enjoy one's labor
It is good and fitting to eat, drink, and rejoice in one's labor as a gift from God
God does not care about our enjoyment
questions.correctAnswer: It is good and fitting to eat, drink, and rejoice in one's labor as a gift from God
questions.explanation: Verses 18-19 teach that enjoying the good of one’s labor every day is good and a portion given by God, encouraging gratitude and contentment.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 5 teaches that it is better to vow to God and delay paying than to never vow at all.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 5 states it is better not to vow than to vow and not pay, emphasizing the importance of integrity and fulfilling commitments promptly.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ecclesiastes 5, God is indifferent to the oppression of the poor and perversion of justice.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 8 clarifies that God, who is higher than the highest rulers, regards all, including oppression and injustice, assuring believers of His sovereign justice.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ecclesiastes 5:20 says, 'For he shall not much remember the days of his life; because God answereth him in the ______ of his heart.'
questions.correctAnswer: joy
questions.explanation: Verse 20 states that God answers a man in the joy of his heart, emphasizing the blessing of rejoicing in God’s provision and presence.

questions.question: How does Ecclesiastes 5 advise believers to guard their speech before God and others?
options: Avoid rash words and keep heart slow to utter before God
Speak as much as possible to show zeal
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid rash words and keep heart slow to utter before God
questions.explanation: Verse 2 warns against rash speech before God and advises letting words be few, promoting reverence and careful speech in spiritual settings.

hard.title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ecclesiastes Chapter 5.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 5:1, what attitude should one have when going to the house of God?
options: Be more ready to hear than to give the sacrifice of fools
Offer many sacrifices to demonstrate piety
questions.correctAnswer: Be more ready to hear than to give the sacrifice of fools
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:1 advises to keep one's foot when going to the house of God and to be more ready to hear than to give the sacrifice of fools, emphasizing careful listening over rash offerings.

questions.question: What is the primary reason given in Ecclesiastes 5:2 for letting words be few before God?
options: God is in heaven, and you are on earth
People understand dreams better when they speak more
The heart should be quick to utter words
questions.correctAnswer: God is in heaven, and you are on earth
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:2 explains that because God is in heaven and humans are on earth, words should be few before Him, highlighting the vast difference between God and man.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 5:3 uses the metaphor of a dream coming through what?
questions.correctAnswer: The multitude of business
questions.explanation: Verse 3 states that a dream comes through the multitude of business, suggesting that many words or activities can produce confused or meaningless speech, often recognized as folly.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 5:4 instruct regarding vows made to God?
options: Do not defer to pay them
Make many vows to show devotion
Avoid making any vows at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: Do not defer to pay them
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:4 commands that when one vows a vow unto God, one should not delay in fulfilling it, as God has no pleasure in fools who do not pay their vows.

questions.question: Which statement best summarizes Ecclesiastes 5:5 about vows?
options: It is better not to vow than to vow and not pay
Vows can be broken if necessary
All vows must be publicly announced
questions.correctAnswer: It is better not to vow than to vow and not pay
questions.explanation: Verse 5 states that it is better not to make a vow than to make one and fail to fulfill it, emphasizing integrity in speech and promises.

questions.question: In Ecclesiastes 5:6, why should one not cause their flesh to sin with their mouth?
options: Because God might be angry and destroy the work of your hands
Because angels record all spoken words
questions.correctAnswer: Because God might be angry and destroy the work of your hands
questions.explanation: Verse 6 warns that rash speech can cause sin, provoking God's anger which could lead to the destruction of one’s work, highlighting the serious consequences of careless words.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 5:7 connects the multitude of dreams and many words with what?
questions.correctAnswer: Divers vanities
questions.explanation: Verse 7 indicates that many dreams and many words contain divers vanities, which means various emptiness or futility, but it exhorts to fear God.

questions.question: What is the reason given in Ecclesiastes 5:8 for not marveling at oppression and injustice?
options: Because he that is higher than the highest regardeth
Because justice is not important in the world
Because the poor deserve their fate
Because the king is always just
questions.correctAnswer: Because he that is higher than the highest regardeth
questions.explanation: Verse 8 explains that one should not marvel at oppression and injustice because God, who is higher than the highest, regards all, and there are powers above earthly rulers.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 5:9 say about the profit of the earth?
options: It is for all, even the king is served by the field
It belongs only to the wealthy
It is reserved for the priests
It is a reward for the righteous
questions.correctAnswer: It is for all, even the king is served by the field
questions.explanation: Verse 9 states that the profit of the earth is for all, emphasizing that even kings depend on the produce of the land, highlighting the unity of all people under God’s provision.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 5:10 reveals the nature of loving silver and abundance. What is it?
options: They never satisfy, this is vanity
questions.correctAnswer: They never satisfy, this is vanity
questions.explanation: Verse 10 teaches that loving silver or abundance does not satisfy, indicating the vanity and futility of greed and materialism.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 5:12, how does the sleep of a laboring man compare to that of the rich?
options: The laboring man’s sleep is sweet, the rich’s abundance disturbs sleep
The rich sleep better due to comfort
The laboring man struggles with sleep
questions.correctAnswer: The laboring man’s sleep is sweet, the rich’s abundance disturbs sleep
questions.explanation: Verse 12 contrasts the peaceful sleep of a laboring man with the restless sleep of the rich, whose abundance causes worry.

questions.question: What is described as a 'sore evil' under the sun in Ecclesiastes 5:13?
options: Riches kept for their owners to their hurt
questions.correctAnswer: Riches kept for their owners to their hurt
questions.explanation: Verse 13 identifies the hoarding of riches by their owners, which ultimately harms them, as a sore evil observed under the sun.

questions.question: Ecclesiastes 5:15 uses which literary device to emphasize the futility of labor and riches?
options: Typology of nakedness at birth and death
questions.correctAnswer: Typology of nakedness at birth and death
questions.explanation: Verse 15 uses typology by showing man comes naked into the world and leaves naked, taking nothing from his labor, emphasizing the vanity of earthly toil.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 5:18 say is good and comely for one to do under the sun?
options: To eat, drink, and enjoy the good of all his labor
questions.correctAnswer: To eat, drink, and enjoy the good of all his labor
questions.explanation: Verse 18 states that it is good and fitting for a person to enjoy the fruits of their labor, which God gives as their portion under the sun.

questions.question: True or False: Ecclesiastes 5:20 teaches that God answers a man in the joy of his heart, so he does not much remember the days of his life.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 20 confirms that because God answers a man in the joy of his heart, the man does not much remember the days of his life, focusing instead on his enjoyment.

theological.title: Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ecclesiastes Chapter 5 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 5, what attitude should one have when approaching the house of God?
options: Be more ready to hear than to give a sacrifice of fools
questions.correctAnswer: Be more ready to hear than to give a sacrifice of fools
questions.explanation: Ecclesiastes 5:1 instructs believers to be more ready to hear than to give the sacrifice of fools, which aligns with Jesus' teaching in Matthew 7:21-23 about sincere worship and James 1:19 about being quick to listen and slow to speak.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 5:2 warn about the use of the mouth before God?
options: Let thy words be few and avoid rash speech
Speak freely and often before God
Argue with God to get what you want
Make many vows to show devotion
questions.correctAnswer: Let thy words be few and avoid rash speech
questions.explanation: Verse 2 emphasizes the need to be careful with words before God, reflecting Proverbs 10:19 where many words lead to sin, and James 1:26 about taming the tongue, highlighting reverence for God's holiness.

questions.question: What is the consequence of making a vow to God and not paying it, according to Ecclesiastes 5?
options: God has no pleasure in fools who do not pay their vows
God will forgive any delay in paying vows
Vows are optional and can be broken
questions.correctAnswer: God has no pleasure in fools who do not pay their vows
questions.explanation: Verses 4 and 5 emphasize the seriousness of vows; God desires fulfillment of promises, which parallels Numbers 30:2 and Matthew 5:33-37 where Jesus teaches about the integrity of one's word.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 5:6, why should one not cause their flesh to sin with their mouth before God?
options: Because God may be angry and destroy the work of your hands
Because angels will correct your mistake
Because it is a sign of humility
Because God does not hear vain words
questions.correctAnswer: Because God may be angry and destroy the work of your hands
questions.explanation: The verse warns that rash or false speech before God can bring His anger and ruin one’s efforts, which aligns with Proverbs 6:16-19 on things hateful to God and Psalm 90:17 about God's blessing on our work.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 5:7 advise believers to do amidst many words and dreams?
questions.correctAnswer: Fear God
questions.explanation: Verse 7 highlights that despite vanities and many words, fearing God is the proper response, consistent with Proverbs 1:7 on the fear of the Lord being the beginning of knowledge and Acts 9:31 about living in the fear of the Lord.

questions.question: How does Ecclesiastes 5:8 describe God's oversight of injustice and oppression?
options: God who is higher than the highest regards all things
Justice is left to human judges alone
questions.correctAnswer: God who is higher than the highest regards all things
questions.explanation: Verse 8 teaches that God sovereignly oversees justice and judgment despite earthly corruption, reflecting Psalm 103:19 about God's throne above all and Romans 13:1 on God's authority over rulers.

questions.question: What truth about wealth and satisfaction is taught in Ecclesiastes 5:10?
options: Loving silver or abundance leads to never being satisfied
Silver is the ultimate goal of life
questions.correctAnswer: Loving silver or abundance leads to never being satisfied
questions.explanation: This verse reveals the vanity in the love of wealth, echoing 1 Timothy 6:9-10 on the dangers of the love of money and Psalm 62:10 about the emptiness of trusting in riches.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 5:12 contrast about the sleep of a laborer and the rich?
options: The laborer sleeps sweetly, but the rich’s abundance disturbs their sleep
The rich sleep better than laborers
questions.correctAnswer: The laborer sleeps sweetly, but the rich’s abundance disturbs their sleep
questions.explanation: Verse 12 contrasts the peaceful rest of the hardworking with the restless anxiety that wealth can bring, paralleling Psalm 127:2 and Luke 12:15 warning against anxiety over possessions.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 5:15, what happens to a person’s wealth at death?
options: They leave naked and take nothing from their labor
They take all their wealth with them
They pass on their wealth to angels
questions.correctAnswer: They leave naked and take nothing from their labor
questions.explanation: This verse emphasizes the futility of accumulating wealth for oneself at death, consistent with Job 1:21 and Psalm 49:16-17 on the inability to carry wealth beyond the grave.

questions.question: What is the 'sore evil' described in Ecclesiastes 5:13-14 related to riches?
options: Riches kept to the hurt of their owners and lost by evil toil
Riches used to help the poor
Riches given as offerings to God
questions.correctAnswer: Riches kept to the hurt of their owners and lost by evil toil
questions.explanation: These verses describe the tragedy of wealth hoarded to the owner's harm and lost through toil, echoing Luke 12:16-21 on the parable of the rich fool and James 5:1-3 on the corruption of hoarded wealth.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 5:16 ask about the profit of laboring for the wind?
options: What profit has he that labored for the wind?
questions.correctAnswer: What profit has he that labored for the wind?
questions.explanation: This rhetorical question highlights the futility of labor without lasting gain, paralleling Isaiah 49:4 and 1 Corinthians 15:58 about laboring for eternal purposes rather than vanity.

questions.question: What attitude toward work and enjoyment does Ecclesiastes 5:18 promote?
options: It is good to enjoy the fruits of one’s labor given by God
Work should be avoided as vanity
One must give all to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: It is good to enjoy the fruits of one’s labor given by God
questions.explanation: Verse 18 affirms the goodness of enjoying God's provision for one’s labor, consistent with 1 Timothy 6:17, Psalm 128:2, and Colossians 3:23-24 about receiving God's gifts with gratitude.

questions.question: According to Ecclesiastes 5:19, who is the giver of riches and the ability to enjoy them?
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: Verse 19 highlights that God grants riches and the power to enjoy them, echoing James 1:17 and Deuteronomy 8:18 about God as the source of all blessings.

questions.question: What does Ecclesiastes 5:20 state about the joy of the heart in relation to life’s days?
options: God answers in the joy of the heart, so days are not much remembered
Joy in the heart increases the count of days
Life’s days are remembered more than joy
questions.correctAnswer: God answers in the joy of the heart, so days are not much remembered
questions.explanation: This verse teaches that joy from God makes life’s hardships less remembered, which aligns with Nehemiah 8:10 and John 15:11 about joy being a deep spiritual gift.

questions.question: What does the multitude of words and dreams in Ecclesiastes 5 lead to, and what is the remedy?
options: They lead to vanities; the remedy is to fear God
They lead to wisdom; the remedy is more speech
They cause confusion; the remedy is silence
They cause joy; the remedy is celebration
questions.correctAnswer: They lead to vanities; the remedy is to fear God
questions.explanation: Verse 7 explains many words and dreams bring vanities, but fearing God is the proper response, consistent with Ecclesiastes 12:13 and Proverbs 9:10 about fearing God as foundational.
